page.title: 15Oystermouth Church
page.content:
All Saints Church was built in 1140. The most recent part of the building is only 70 years old. There have been 30 Vicars. The first one was Vicar Samson and the present one is the Reverend Geoffrey Thomas.
The clock was put in the tower in 1875 by Francis Tippins and the bells hung in 1954. Eight services a week are held. The choir members wear red robes.
Many visitors come each year especially to see the Lady Chapel, the font, the bells from Santiago in Chile and the Lifeboat Memorial Window.
A famous person buried in the churchyard is Thomas Bowdler who expurgated the works of Shakespeare.
